ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: .25 (the class meets for one-hour once a month)
Readings, but not "required"
Before each seminar, I probably spent 30-60 minutes reading the journal article and looking at the previous work of the speaker.
The weeks we had seminar I read the paper and often went to the journal club. This amounted to ~2 hours on the weeks we had the seminar (once a month).
1 hour if there was an article to read
1 hour
1.0 when we had our seminar once a month.
0 hours

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Faculty involved with a journal-club discussing the related-papers prior to the talks.
Good - it showed me how difficult modeling can be but the great research and studies that are going on.
Professors from a variety of fields who's work applied to modeling were chosen to speak. This was a strength that demonstrated the applicability of modeling across disciplines.
Good speakers.

This was a super cool course-- the timing was perfect, I feel like I learned from the sessions, and was able to draw parallels to things I was working on in class. It also introduced modeling concepts far more complex than I've seen, which I think was a helpful way of demonstrating the scope of the field.
I thought this seminar was interesting and most of the speakers were accessible to students who did not have prior experience with modeling.
I loved this seminar series and I'm looking forward to next semester. Great job with guest lecturers, very interesting material.
good to know the latest research in the modeling field

It is a nice way to experience and learn about different modeling projects and research going on in a large range of fields. However some of the talks get so complicated even after reading the papers that it is difficult to follow.
It was very interesting. My favorite session was when we talking about the live donor kidney transplant chains.
Simple seminar series with interesting speakers.
Seminars are informative.
Excellent

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: A David Paltiel  Nice. Didn't give any seminar, just introduced speakers.
Instructor: A David Paltiel  There was no teaching in this seminar course.
Instructor: A David Paltiel  He was not present this term.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Nice guy. He didn't give any seminar, just introduced speakers.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Good instructor in arranging the course and bring in the outside speakers
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  good
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  There was no teaching in this seminar course.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  He was helpful in explaining the modeling requirements.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Excellent
Instructor: Virginia Pitzer  Nice. Didn't give any seminar, just introduced speakers.
Instructor: Virginia Pitzer  Excellent
Instructor: Virginia Pitzer  There was no teaching in this seminar course.
Instructor: Virginia Pitzer  She did a good job explaining the modeling requirements.
Instructor: Virginia Pitzer  Excellent

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Interesting monthly seminar on modeling.
If you are interested in PH modeling or considering it, it's required. If you are unsure, take it. It will help you decide whether to continue the concentration or not.
If one has interest in modeling, this course is a way to explore this interest without the necessity of any time investment.
I would recommend it.

Great exposure to public health modeling! Perfect for people who are interested in working on interdisciplinary projects, and want to learn more about how people are using statistical models to make the world a better place.
Great opportunity to expose yourself to modeling in different aspects of public health.
yes!

This was a very interesting course that gave a broad view of what the field of modeling is doing. I liked the variety in the lecturers. It served as a reminder that we can use this skill set in any path we choose.
I would summarize it as a good way to expose yourself to the many different projects involved in modeling. I would recommend it to a student if they were interested in modeling.
The seminar shows students ways in which they can use modeling in a future career.
Simple seminar series with interesting speakers.
Most of the seminars are informative.
An excellent seminar series with interesting research topics presented by engaging speakers
